transcript: All along the sides of the road fallen horses were to be seen, some flayed, some not, and broken-down carts be- sidewhich solitary soldiers sat waiting forsome- thing, and again soldiers straggling from their companies, crowds of whom set off to the neigh- boring villages, or returned from them drag- ging sheep, fowls, hay, and bulging sacks. At each ascent or descent of the road the crowds were yet denser and the din of shouting more incessant. Soldiers floundering knee-deep in mud
